Detailed Description

This class implements a subset of the telnet protocol.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TelnetConnection::TelnetConnection ( Mercury::EventDispatcher &  dispatcher,
int  fd 
)

This constructor intitialises the TelnetConnection given an existing socket.

Parameters:
dispatcher A dispatcher with which to register file descriptors.
fd file descriptor of a socked that's ready for reading.

TelnetConnection::~TelnetConnection (  )  [virtual]

This is the destructor.

It deregisters the socket with Mercury. Note that the Endpoint destructor will close the socket.

Member Function Documentation

bool TelnetConnection::active (  )  const [inline]

virtual void TelnetConnection::connectionBad (  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Implemented in KeyboardConnection.

virtual bool TelnetConnection::handleChar (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

Handle a character.

Return false if you need more input. Otherwise remove the input you use and return true.

Reimplemented in KeyboardConnection.

int TelnetConnection::handleInputNotification ( int  fd  )  [virtual]

This method is called by Mercury when the socket is ready for reading.

It processes user input from the socket, and calls virtual fns with it.

Parameters:
fd file descriptor of a socked that's ready for reading.
Returns:
always returns 1.

Implements Mercury::InputNotificationHandler.

virtual bool TelnetConnection::handleVTCommand (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

void TelnetConnection::write ( const char *  str  ) 

This method sends output to the socket.

We don't care too much about buffer overflows or write errors. If the connection drops, we'll hear about it when we next read.

Parameters:
str data to be sent.
